snippet: Sunni militants fighting under the banner of Al Qaeda appeared to make gains across Anbar Province, also capturing the strategic town of Karma.
abstract: Al Qaeda-linked Sunni militants secure nearly full control of Falluja, Iraq, and capture strategic town of Karma; Iraqi Prime Min Nuri Kamal al-Maliki vows to continue fighting until area is cleared of all armed militants.

byline.original: By YASIR GHAZI and TIM ARANGO
byline.contributor: Yasir Ghazi reported from Baghdad, and Tim Arango from Istanbul. An employee of The New York Times contributed reporting from Anbar Province.

lead_paragraph: Sunni militants fighting under the banner of Al Qaeda appeared to make gains across Anbar Province, also capturing the strategic town of Karma.

headline.main: Qaeda-Linked Militants in Iraq Secure Nearly Full Control of Falluja
headline.print_headline: Qaeda-Linked Militants in Iraq Secure Nearly Full Control of Falluja

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )

keywords.value: Islamic State of Iraq and Syria
